title: ISic000402. Mosaic floor recording works dedicated to Venus
body:
1Cn(aeus) Octavio(s) A(uli) f(ilius) mini(ster) cohor(tis) bolonar(um)
2velic(us) Vener(is) Taric(hinae) pavimentum sedi-
3lia fecit aedemque reficiend(am) coir(avit)

1CNOCTAVIOAFMINICOHORBOLONAR
2VELICVENERTARICPAVIMENTUMSEDI
3LIAFECITAEDEMQUEREFICIENDCOIR

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text of Gaggiotti 2002

English translation

Jonathan Prag

Cnaeus Octavius, son of Aulus, officer and administrator of the company of fishmongers made the pavement and benches and saw to the restoration of the temple of Venus Tarichina (Venus of the Saltworks)

commentary

The mosaic is lost, and modern readings are dependent upon an unsatisfactory text recorded in the antiquarian tradition

  • Forni 1980 959 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001454
  • Donati 1967 88 no.183 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002017
  • Tribulato 2012 310-312 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001557
